member.summary: Options for the Hsts Middleware

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HstsOptions.MaxAge
member.summary: Sets the max-age parameter of the Strict-Transport-Security header.
member.remarks: Max-age is required; defaults to 30 days. See:

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HstsOptions.IncludeSubDomains
member.summary: Enables includeSubDomain parameter of the Strict-Transport-Security header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HstsOptions.Preload
member.summary: Sets the preload parameter of the Strict-Transport-Security header.
member.remarks: Preload is not part of the RFC specification, but is supported by web browsers to preload HSTS sites on fresh install. See https://hstspreload.org/.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HstsOptions.ExcludedHosts
member.summary: A list of host names that will not add the HSTS header.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HttpsRedirectionOptions
member.summary: Options for the HTTPS Redirection Middleware.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HttpsRedirectionOptions.RedirectStatusCode
member.summary: The status code used for the redirect response. The default is 307.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpsPolicy.HttpsRedirectionOptions.HttpsPort
member.summary: The HTTPS port to be added to the redirected URL.
member.remarks: If the HttpsPort is not set, we will try to get the HttpsPort from the following: 1. HTTPS_PORT environment variable 2. IServerAddressesFeature If that fails then the middleware will log a warning and turn off.
